snippet.textDisplay: It's easy to have energy in the 4th and 5th rounds when you got your ass beat for the first 3, and the other guy is tired from beating your ass. Idgaf what anyone says. The numbers don't lie. Dominick had 103 total strikes to Jon's 96, and every single takedown by Jones was negated by Reyes. Jon was unable to keep Dominick down for more than a few seconds, and never once finished a round in top position. Reyes also hurt Jon in the 2nd round, and Jones never once put Dominick in ANY trouble. Shitty judging aside, the UFC historically gives Decision victories to champions regardless of how the fight went. The numbers don't lie there either.
snippet.textOriginal: It's easy to have energy in the 4th and 5th rounds when you got your ass beat for the first 3, and the other guy is tired from beating your ass. Idgaf what anyone says. The numbers don't lie. Dominick had 103 total strikes to Jon's 96, and every single takedown by Jones was negated by Reyes. Jon was unable to keep Dominick down for more than a few seconds, and never once finished a round in top position. Reyes also hurt Jon in the 2nd round, and Jones never once put Dominick in ANY trouble. Shitty judging aside, the UFC historically gives Decision victories to champions regardless of how the fight went. The numbers don't lie there either.

snippet.textDisplay:
Here's the fairest possible scoring system:

Each round each fighter can earn anything from 0 to 5 points based on how much damage they inflict on their opponent (5 = you've absolutely pulverised him and he may quit on the stool, 4 = you've landed some serious fucking damage on him that will probably effect him for the rest of the fight, 3 = you've either caught him repeatedly with relatively soft strikes or tagged him with 1 big headkick/punch that's wobbled him, 2 = you've landed a few leg kicks and body shots, no significant damage or head strikes, 1 = no real meaningful damage but you've connected once or twice with a bodyshot/landed a takedown 0 = absolutely no damage in any form on your opponent's body, head or legs

Your score wouldn't be dictated by your opponent's like it is with the 10-9 system. If you get 4 points in a round, your opponent could get 1 in that same round or 5. Also judges would be able to call a round a draw (e.g. 3-3 or 4-4) and unlike with the 10-9 system, it wouldn't significantly increase the chance of the fight ending in a draw due to the increased possibilities in scoring.
snippet.textOriginal:
Here's the fairest possible scoring system:

Each round each fighter can earn anything from 0 to 5 points based on how much damage they inflict on their opponent (5 = you've absolutely pulverised him and he may quit on the stool, 4 = you've landed some serious fucking damage on him that will probably effect him for the rest of the fight, 3 = you've either caught him repeatedly with relatively soft strikes or tagged him with 1 big headkick/punch that's wobbled him, 2 = you've landed a few leg kicks and body shots, no significant damage or head strikes, 1 = no real meaningful damage but you've connected once or twice with a bodyshot/landed a takedown 0 = absolutely no damage in any form on your opponent's body, head or legs

Your score wouldn't be dictated by your opponent's like it is with the 10-9 system. If you get 4 points in a round, your opponent could get 1 in that same round or 5. Also judges would be able to call a round a draw (e.g. 3-3 or 4-4) and unlike with the 10-9 system, it wouldn't significantly increase the chance of the fight ending in a draw due to the increased possibilities in scoring.

snippet.textDisplay: What are we talking about here? I'm confused. I remember when if you wanted to be the champ you had to BEAT the champ and beat them absolutely. You cant slide by the champ DOM! If it was 50 50 I come from the perspective that the challenger always loses bc the champion wasnt dethroned. Jones wasnt even close to hurt. As far as I saw. Hey dom. You had 5 rounds to do your job. The one thing you had was that power and jones ate it up no problem. What are you COMPLAINING and crying about on interviews. If anything now I really dont even want to see the rematch. Let the goat move on and let new challengers come like gustaffson did and give a more exciting fight. Rashad said it best if you wanna be the champion you gotta beat the champion and dom couldnt do it clearly.

snippet.textDisplay:
This is ridiculous, I completely disagree with Rogan's hot take. Reyes was tired by the end of the fight, his fist 5 round fight.

But so was Jon, Dom won 1-3 by a higher margin than Jon won 4-5. Look at the stats, at the end Dom couldn't walk because half of Jon's significant strikes on the later rounds were leg kicks.

But if we're talking about a true fight to the death, what tells us that Jon survives the fist three rounds without breaks when Dom knows he has to finish him and not last over 5 rounds.

This is an idiotic way to rationalize this outcome.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Youtube "i suck joe rogans dick til i disagree with him then i have a bitch fit in the comments and tell him no sex tonight bc im on my period" fans piss me off. None of you know what its like to fight like that. Much less 5 rounds. This is champ rounds. Not a 3 round fight. 5 rounds matter for a reason. Are you champ ready or nah? Reyes was dumb and young to just go out there and apply pressure for aslong as he could. Jones, a vet, absorbed hella shots. Checked, parried, blocked and protected himself for the absolute most part. He was hardly hurt. Fight just looked good on reyes end. This isnt tag. If a kid in school was punching u in the face multiple times and the class was like ohhhhhh u look like a bitch. But if u punch him once and his lip busts and hes bleeding and the teacher breaks yall up...who won? We going off points here? Mma is about the best technique and the best fighter. Ufc brings us that as safely as possible. Who can kill who? But once we get to champ stats now we gotta involve politics bc of judges and fans. 1st 2 rds? Reyes. Even then all he was doing was gassing himself bc he hadnt figured out john. 3rd rd idk. Very close. So it goes to champ. Politics. Last 2. Champ. Easy. Reyes wasnt ready. Gassed and didnt know jones well enough in that fight bc he didnt take the time. Too much pressure and u not only limit your opponent but also urself. Now ur gassed and dnt even know who ur fighting. 3 rounds to the champ if u wanna do it by rounds. Technique to the champ. Just being a champ? To the champ. We can have a rematch but i already know how jones fights. Reyes put his all out there. John didnt. John has way more and we all know it. If we have a rematch reyes is dead.

snippet.textDisplay: 7:20 yes, Joe. It is a dumb way to judge it because it is judged as a per round 10-9 basis. That is the sport we are talking about, not a street fight, not even a Pride fight that was judged as a whole fight. It is a per round basis, and all rounds are treated equally. Those are the agreed upon rules so that's why Reyes should have gotten the decision.
snippet.textOriginal: 7:20 yes, Joe.  It is a dumb way to judge it because it is judged as a per round 10-9 basis.  That is the sport we are talking about, not a street fight, not even a Pride fight that was judged as a whole fight.  It is a per round basis, and all rounds are treated equally.  Those are the agreed upon rules so that's why Reyes should have gotten the decision.

snippet.textDisplay: But that makes no sense to say that the later rounds should be more important because if there were no rounds it’d be a fight to the death.. the fact that there are 5 rounds is taken into account for the athletes game plan, if it was untimed death match every fighter would fight much differently. If people want the fight to be scores by who looks better at the end then cut out all the rounds and make it a fuckin death match.

snippet.textDisplay: Where was everyone when Jones fought Gustaffson 1? He was left battered and barely standing. Reyes, meanwhile, gave up Octagon control in Round 3. He had resigned himself to the idea that he's simply going to throw as many punches as possible to get that percentage. How is that "winning"? Oh, almost forgot the cherry on top: out of strikes thrown, Jones landed a bigger percentage than Reyes in every round. So if you're not willing to give Gustaffson 1 the victory, what are we talking about?
snippet.textOriginal: Where was everyone when Jones fought Gustaffson 1? He was left battered and barely standing. Reyes, meanwhile, gave up Octagon control in Round 3. snippet.textDisplay: Please stop with this "gotta beat the champ to be the champ" that's absolute nonsense and thinking that the last 2 rounds should mean more is ridiculous. This isn't a fight to the death, it's a sport. Please stop spreading that

snippet.textDisplay:
Bruh “fight to the death”.
Dom signed up for a 5 round fight vs Jon , you can argue the value of rounds but the fact of the matter is that every round has to be judged subjectively!!!Dom won 3/5 rounds and so he should’ve been crowned.

snippet.textDisplay: The bias towards Jones is actually painful sometimes. Greatest of all time but Reyes won that fight, it's long been known that the judging in UFC fights is a complete shambles. You can't justify his win by saying "I was impressed with the shots he took" and "if there was 5 more rounds Jones would have won" There was 5 rounds, Reyes won the first 3, Jones won the last 2. Reyes wins 3 rounds to 2, he's been robbed. Hopefully Reyes can keep his head held high and keep up the momentum and get another shot at the title down the line.
snippet.textOriginal: The bias towards Jones is actually painful sometimes. Greatest of all time but Reyes won that fight, it's long been known that the judging in UFC fights is a complete shambles. You can't justify his win by saying "I was impressed with the shots he took" and "if there was 5 more rounds Jones would have won" There was 5 rounds, Reyes won the first 3, Jones won the last 2. Reyes wins 3 rounds to 2, he's been robbed. Hopefully Reyes can keep his head held high and keep up the momentum and get another shot at the title down the line.

snippet.textDisplay: Piggie backing on your scorecard modding, why not score the championship rounds (4 & 5) as double the value? Meaning if you lose the first 3 rounds (27-30)  and win 4 and 5 (20-18)x2 =40-36) its now scored 67-66. Basically it wouldn't alter any other outcome in a 3 or 5 round fight, except in the event you win the final two rounds of a championship fight. Food for thought
snippet.textOriginal: Piggie backing on your scorecard modding, why not score the championship rounds (4 & 5) as double the value? Meaning if you lose the first 3 rounds (27-30)  and win 4 and 5 (20-18)x2 =40-36) its now scored 67-66. snippet.textDisplay: No, the last two rounds do not carry more weight than the first three. 3 rounds Reyes to 2 Jones is not a win for Jones. If you want to fight to the "death" then fight to the death. Love Joe but he's towing the company line here in defending the decision that Jones won. Reyes was robbed, I'm not a fan of either so I really could care less who won, I just question the integrity of the game at this point.
